narrative.title: 9Th Infantry Division - 1943Q1
narrative.situation: American Triangular Infantry Division deployed in North Africa during 1943Q1.
narrative.objectives: US Army triangular infantry division conducting sustained offensive operations in Tunisia Campaign Q1 1943. Participated in Operation Torch landings at Port Lyautey (November 1942) and subsequent advance into Tunisia. Engaged in mountain warfare and defensive-offensive operations during Kasserine Pass battles (February 1943) and final Tunisia offensive (March-May 1943).
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: mountainous terrain and valleys (Tunisia Campaign, Kasserine Pass region)

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Experienced in amphibious operations (Port Lyautey assault)
Triangular division flexibility for combined arms maneuver
M1 Garand semi-automatic rifle standard issue
Three months combat experience by Q1 1943

environment.terrain_type: mountainous terrain and valleys (Tunisia Campaign, Kasserine Pass region)
